div1.p: At a regular term of the Circuit Court of the State of Oregon for the County of Union began and held at the Court House in Lelpaude Oregon on the first day of November AD 1869 there was present here JG Wilson Judge AC Craig Sheriff and ES McCoreras County Clerk
Due proclamation of the Opening of Court having been made. The following among other business was transacted on the fifth Judicial day of said term

Now this cause coming on to be heard Plaintiff appeared by RA Prince her attorney and the Defendant although duly served with process appeared not, but made default, and the Prosecuting Attorney appearing in behalf of the State. Now therefore due consideration of the allegations in the complaint and the evidence submitted to the Court and on Motion of Said Plaintiffs attorney it is ordered and adjudged that the marriage contract existing between the plaintiff and defendant be dissolved
on account of habitual gross drunkeness on the part of the defendant contracted since the marriage contract existing between the plaintiff and defendant, and continuing for two years next prior to the commencement of this suit, and on account further of cruel and inhumane treatment and personal indignities making life burthensome by the Defendant to the Plaintiff and it appearing further by the allegations and proof that these parties have one child by the name of Ella Dora Craven of the age of three years. Therefore on motion of said plffs attorney it is further ordered and decreed that the said plaintiff Martha have the custody and education of said Ella Dora and that the defendant William Harry Craven pay the costs and disbursements herein to be received made and expended to be herin taxed and that execution issue therefore.
